The inaugural edition of the "HR Conclave" is scheduled to be held on 7th October(Saturday) from 2 pm to 4:30 pm in Kalidas Auditorium. It is being organized by the Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur. The dress code for the event is Semi-formals. A moderated panel discussion is going to be held on the topic- "Harmonizing with the Disruption Economy: Emotional, Cultural and Generational Intelligence" which would aim at answering questions regarding constantly changing the business scene with a focus on disruption and its impact on Human Resources. The panel comprises of nation's top Business Leaders and Industry Stalwarts which includes:-
    1) Mr. Amulya Sah: Director HR, Samsung R&D Institute, 
        India
  2) Mr. Prateek Dubey: Director HR, IDFC Bank
  3) Ms. Deepti Vij: Assistant Director, E&Y- GDS
  4) Mr. Rajesh Hurkat: Head HR, Mattel India
  5) Mrs. Kiran Bhatia Tandon: Head Talent Acquisition, Stryker 
       Corporation
   6)  Mr. Ayan Pal: Moderator, Author, Distinguished 
        Toastmaster, stellar communicator, and leader
Interested ones can fill this form:- https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfBzkEj8or4eDLU6gbvW8_igY80XOwGhRJwSH5qpdSKEGcJWg/viewform
For any queries, contact the undersigned:-
Halima Akhtar 9540353676    Harshil Agrawal 9428412397
Shubham 9758228124            Divya 9545812167

The 33rd Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet, four days of aquatics extravaganza, conducted by IIT Madras, witnessed an enthralling performance by the participants. Here are the final results and summary of this meet.  

The Final Standings are as follows:

Swimming: Men’s
1. IIT Madras (11 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 84 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 2 Silver, 4 Bronze) - 29 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 3 Silver, 3 Bronze) - 26 pts
4. IIT Delhi (3 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 25 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 5 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 25 pts

Swimming: Women's
1. IIT Madras (3 Gold, 3 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 28 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 2 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 24 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 8 pts
4. IIT Kharagpur ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 8 pts
5. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 5 pts

Water Polo:
Gold - IIT Kanpur
Silver - IIT Kharagpur
Bronze - IIT Madras

Top four finishers in Swimming from IIT Kharagpur:
Men’s
Kryalos Indresh: 100m Breaststroke (Silver), 200m Breaststroke (Silver), 50m Breaststroke (Silver)
Gitanshu Bhatia: 200m Backstroke(Bronze), 50m Backstroke (Bronze)
Shubham Pandey: 100m Freestyle (Silver), 50m Freestyle (4th position)
Pushpak Roy: 100m Backstroke (4th position), 50m Breaststroke (4th Position)
4 x 100m Medley Relay: Gitanshu Bhatia, Kryalos Indresh, Pushpak Roy, Shubham Pandey (Team Silver)

Women’s 
Women’s 4x50m Freestyle Relay: Prutha Kale, Oindrila Saha, Barsa Majumder, Nastassja Rai (Bronze)
Prutha Kale: 50m Butterfly (Bronze), 50m Freestyle (4th position)
Oindrila Saha: 50m Butterfly (4th position)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates all the winners and gives a huge round of applause to all the participants who gave it all and left no stone unturned in bringing laurels to IIT Kharagpur.

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet | Day 4 | Evening Session

||Swimming||

Men’s
Kryalos Indresh bagged Silver in Men’s 50m Breaststroke finals finishing his performance in flying colours with a sum total of 3 individual silvers in the meet. Pushpak Roy stood at the 5th place in the same event.
Shubham Pandey won Silver in Men’s 100m Freestyle and Gitu Bhatia secured Bronze in Men’s 200m Backstroke event.

Women’s
Nastassja Rai stood at 8th place in Women’s 100m Freestyle finals.

||Waterpolo||

Defending champions IIT Kharagpur bagged silver after a nail-biting final match against IIT Kanpur. After an exciting tie at 3-3, the match still stood tied after penalties and it was finally decided 'Sudden Death'.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners.

Stay tuned to Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur for final updates and medal tally.

IIT Kharagpur vs IIT Kanpur - Water Polo Final
Defending champions IIT KGP are taking on arch rivals IIT Kanpur in the finals of the Water Polo. 
KGP is trailing by 2-3 at the moment. 
KGP makes a comeback and levels the score by 3-3.
The match goes down to penalties now, indeed a nail-biting finish!
Still a tie!
It has now gone to 'Sudden Death'.
Kanpur's player shoots the ball, it hits the net and Kanpur wins the final!
Heartbreak for KGPians! 
Well played team KGP! We all are proud of you all.
.
Catch the action live here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q6syPQ0e7yc

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 4
Water Polo
After a highly thumping win over IIT Roorkee by a margin of 10-2, the Defending Champions IITKGP are now one win away from the trophy. 

Swimming
Our team comprising of Gitu Bhatia, Kryalos Indresh, Pushpak Roy and Shubham Pandey took home silver in the Men's 4X100m medley relay. Gitu Bhatia bagged a bronze in the Men's 200m backstroke event. Kryalos Indresh and Pushpak Roy qualified for the finals of Men's 50m breaststroke. Shubham Pandey qualified for Men's 100m freestyle finals while Nastassja Rai qualified for the Women's 100m freestyle finals. All the finals will be held today afternoon.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes our contingent all the best for finishing off the Inter IIT Aquatics Meet with accolades.

Kryalos Indresh and Pushpak Roy qualified for the finals of Men's 50m breaststroke. Shubham Pandey qualified for Men's 100m freestyle finals while Nastassja Rai qualified for the Women's 100m freestyle finals. All the finals will be held today afternoon.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes our contingent all the best for finishing off the Inter IIT Aquatics Meet with accolades.

Professor Samit Kumar Ray, Professor at the Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur has been elected fellow of the National Academy of Sciences, India (NASI) for the year 2017. He is also serving as the current Director of S.N. Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences, Kolkata.
Prof. S.K. Ray joined the institute in 1991. He already has several awards and honours in his kitty including MRSI-ICSC Superconductivity & Materials Science Annual Prize (2015) and INSA Young Scientist Award (1993). He is also a member of IEEE, USA. 
The National Academy of Sciences, India was founded in the year 1930, with the objectives to provide a national forum for the publication of research work carried out by Indian scientists and to provide opportunities for exchange of views among them. The Academy undertakes several “science-society” programs under the guidance of its Presidents and Fellows. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him and wishes all the best for future endeavours!

Men's
Gitu Bhatia bagged bronze in the 50m backstroke event. In the finals of the 100m butterfly, Pushpak Roy bagged the fifth position. Shubham Pandey got the fourth spot in the 50m freestyle event. 

||Waterpolo||
The league match between IIT Kharagpur and IIT Bombay ended in a draw with the scoreline reading 4-4. With this IITKGP sits pretty at the top of Group A and will meet the runner-up of Group B in the semifinals tomorrow at 10:30 am.

The current standings are as follows: 
Men's
1. IIT Madras (8 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 64 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 2 Silver, 3 Bronze) - 25 pts
3. IIT Delhi (2 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 19 pts
4. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 3 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 19 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 2 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 10 pts

2nd Inter IIT Cultural Meet 

Technology Students' Gymkhana has invited applications for overall vice-captains, cup-wise captain/vice-captain for the Inter IIT Cultural Meet to be held at IIT Kanpur from 28th to 30th December 2017. Details of each cup are provided in the link.( https://gymkhana.iitb.ac.in/~cultural/interiit/)
Eligibility: Students having at least 2 years of experience at IIT Kharagpur, except those sitting for upcoming placements (2017-18) are eligible.
Sample CV format is shown in the link (https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B-2KQCCDgrH-dzRTTHBKQ2hqeEhoVjZiWlNwZ19NdTMzWVY0)
All the applications (attach CV in PDF format) should be emailed to tsg.socult@gmail.com by 5th October 2017, 11:59 PM. The selections will be made on the basis of CV’s and Interviews(if needed).
The subject of Mail: 
1.For Overall Vice captains
[OVERALL] APPLICATION FOR VICE CAPTAIN – NAME
2.For cup-wise captain/vice-captain:
[CUP NAME] APPLICATION FOR CAPTAIN /VICE CAPTAIN – NAME 
e.g. [DRAMATICS] APPLICATION FOR CAPTAIN /VICE CAPTAIN – NAME 

Credits: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 2 || Updates and Points Table

Waterpolo
Defending champions IIT Kharagpur beat the hosts and one of the favourites IIT Madras 5-4 in an epic underwater battle. IITKGP tops the points table of Group A with 6 points.

Swimming
In the morning session Prutha Kale opened the medal tally for IIT Kharagpur Women's Team with a bronze in 50m butterfly event while Oindrila Saha secured the fourth position in the same event. Kryalos Indresh bagged his second silver of the meet with his spectacular performance in Men's 100m Breaststroke event. Shubham Pandey secured the sixth position in Men's 50m Butterfly and Raj Prabhu also stood sixth in Men's 200m Freestyle event.

The current standings are as follows: 
Men's
1. IIT Madras (5 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 49 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 1 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 19 pts
3. IIT Delhi (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 12 pts
4. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 11 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 2 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 7 pts
Women's
1. IIT Madras (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 10 pts
2. IIT Bombay (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 9 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 8 pts
4. IIT Kharagpur ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts
4. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts
For complete results, please visit http://www.interiit.com/scheduleandresults

In the morning session Prutha Kale opened the medal tally for IIT Kharagpur Women's Team with a bronze in 50m butterfly event while Oindrila Saha secured the fourth position in the same event. Kryalos Indresh bagged his second silver of the meet with his spectacular performance in Men's 100m Breaststroke event. Shubham Pandey secured the sixth position in Men's 50m Butterfly and Raj Prabhu also stood sixth in Men's 200m Freestyle event.

The current standings are as follows: 
Men's
1. IIT Madras (5 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 49 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 1 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 19 pts
3. IIT Delhi (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 12 pts
4. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 11 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 2 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 7 pts
Women's
1. IIT Madras (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 10 pts
2. IIT Bombay (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 9 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 8 pts
4. IIT Kharagpur ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts
4. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts
For complete results, please visit http://www.interiit.com/scheduleandresults

The much-awaited Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet finally kicked off today. Our contingent is trying to leave no stone unturned to bag it.
Today, Indresh qualified for Men's 200m Breaststroke finals, Gitu Bhatia and Pushpak Roy qualified for Men's 100m Backstroke finals and Prutha Kale qualified for Women's 50m Breaststroke finals to be held in the afternoon session today. Oindrila Saha and Prutha Kale have qualified for the finals of Women's 50m Butterfly event to be held tomorrow.
Besides, Defending Champions IIT Kharagpur comfortably defeated IIT Guwahati 11-0 in Water Polo encounter. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the qualifying participants good luck for their final breakdown in the afternoon.

The Inter IIT Sports Meet 2017, was inaugurated in a dazzling open ceremony at IIT Madras, with the 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics being the first event for the meet. Arjuna Awardee, 3 times national champion, distinguished Olympian and swimmer Mr. Rehan Poncha was the chief guest for the opening ceremony. He shared his vast experience in sports and encouraged the athletes for their active participation in the sports. 
The Inter IIT Aquatics Meet that will span over 4 days comprises of 18 events. Over 200 participants from 11 IITs are participating in the mega event. Apart from the heats of some events, IIT Madras will witness the finals of 100m backstroke, 200m breaststroke, and 400m freestyle events for men and 50m backstroke and 50m breaststroke events for women today. In addition, IIT Kharagpur will face IIT Guwahati in a much-anticipated Waterpolo encounter at 12:00pm.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the athletes all the best.

All the hackathon enthusiasts who are presently in Delhi and nearby areas are advised to attend first of its kind initiative by Government of India.

|| Foreign Training Guide ||

Foreign Training (FT) is one of the most sought after opportunities for the students, especially those who are interested in pursuing research. Along with providing great research opportunities to the students, a Foreign Training Internship also helps them in inculcating leadership qualities and give an experience about new places and cultures.
By this time, students tend to start working on how to get an FT. However, many students are not well informed about how to begin with the process.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents to you all the basic guide on how to apply for Foreign Training and we hope that it will prove to be quite insightful as it has been for the previous batches.
This article provides the students an insight into the entire process of applying for Foreign Internship, either through Research Programs or through the regular process of mailing the professors in an efficient and streamlined manner.
We would also like to point out that one should not blindly go for an FT under the impression of just getting a good point to add to his/her resume. Students should also look into the research projects and similar opportunities at our own institute and get involved in them as well.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/ft.php?page=reports

Three alumni from IIT Kharagpur - Mainak Sarkar (Electrical), Pritam Khan and Sumit Agarwal (both Computer Science) along with fourth co-founder Abhijit Ghosh (Civil Engineering, IIEST Shibpur) have developed a social network-cum-utility platform for food lovers where they can connect with other fellow foodies and also their favourite eateries named 'Eatable'. 
On this platform, users can connect with fellow foodies and share their experiences, recommend their favourite eating places to their friends and followers, and help add a place to the network’s database. It also allows eateries (restaurants, cafes, bars, pubs and others) from any location with internet access to join the platform and connect with their customers and keep them engaged and updated about all their activities in real time.

Source: http://www.hindustantimes.com/education/iit-kharagpur-alumni-develop-social-network-to-connect-foodies-to-eateries/story-NXVJQCTAZyt2nxsNPc75PL.html

Source: http://www.hindustantimes.com/education/iit-kharagpur-alumni-develop-social-network-to-connect-foodies-to-eateries/story-NXVJQCTAZyt2nxsNPc75PL.html

The administration is in the process of revamping the existing curriculum and offering its students a potentially state-of-the-art type of curriculum. The recently held Senate has decided to invite views from all the stakeholders in order to accommodate all possible suggestions and revise the curriculum for the academic year 2018-19 and beyond accordingly. In this regard, a feedback form has been designed by the consensus of UG Senate Representative and all UG council members. The link to the form is given below and the students are requested to fill the form before the deadline of 5th October 2017.
https://goo.gl/forms/7O94TJRK37CxekyP2
  Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates this move from the administration and urges the student community to actively be a part of this feedback mechanism by ensuring that you are filling it with seriousness and dedication. First and second year students might not have an idea about some of the queries related to projects, industry exposure, etc. and they can gather the information regarding it from relevant sources. All the students are requested to devote some time, suggest even the minute details and help the administration make the revamp a successful one. The fact that such revamp is happening after almost a decade and there are minimal chances that a big revamp would occur in near future after this, so everyone should make the best use of the opportunity and help IIT Kharagpur and upcoming generation of students reap the benefits of your experiences and ideas.
 It is advisable to go through the academic curriculum of some of the elite universities and suggest accordingly. We must ponder over the question that why the courses on the educational platforms like coursera, edx, etc. seem to attract so many students and why we can’t make our courses interesting enough for the students to motivate them to attend the classes. Inputs from everyone among the student community matters. Here we provide some of the links to the course structure of some of the elite universities.
https://www.stanford.edu/list/academic/
http://catalog.mit.edu/subjects/
https://www.si.umich.edu/programs/courses
 We hope that the administration also ropes in the alumni who have studied under the present curriculum and can give insights about how those courses are helping them in current situations and how the improvements can be brought forth.

|| 6th Inter IIT Tech Meet || Problem Statements

The 6th Inter IIT Tech Meet will be held from 05.01.2018 to 07.01.2018 at IIT Madras.
The problem statements for the events have been released and can be found in the link below. Interested students can send in their applications at tech.gymkhana@gmail.com after going through the problem statements. The application should contain the cover letter along with the student's CV. The subject of the mail should be [Problem Statement][Name][Roll No.].
Deadline: 03.10.2017, 12.30 AM
No applications after this deadline will be accepted under any circumstances.
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4TlhthhU1diNXNRLS0zS2dsUFU
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the tech-enthusiasts all the best and hopes that the students would utilise their Durga Puja Holidays in analysing the problems.
Credits: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur

"सदियों की ठंढी-बुझी राख सुगबुगा उठी, 
मिट्टी सोने का ताज पहन इठलाती है; 
दो राह,समय के रथ का घर्घर-नाद सुनो, 
सिंहासन खाली करो कि जनता आती है।"
                                                         -जनतंत्र का जन्म(26/01/1950)

उनकी लेखनी में जितनी उग्रता है, उतनी ही शीतलता भी है। एक ऐसे कवि जिन्होंने भारतवर्ष और उसके जनमानस की आशा, निराशा, प्रत्याशा, सब कुछ को अपनी लेखनी में समेटा और उनकी आवाज़ बुलंद की। भारतीयता और राष्ट्रीयता का पर्याय बन चुके हिंदी के प्रतिनिधि कवि रामधारी सिंह 'दिनकर' के जन्मदिवस पर उनको कोटि कोटि नमन। 
उनकी लेखनी का अभूतपूर्व स्वाद www.kavitakosh.org/dinkar से लिया जा सकता है। उनकी जीवनी और उनके लेखन के बारे में जानने के लिए ये वीडियो देख सकते हैं--https://youtu.be/0qlM66a3k-c

A team of researchers at IIT Kharagpur has developed a solution to prevent hacking into the devices supporting the Internet of Things (IoT). With the products enabled with internet connectivity facilitating our lives, their security has also become a major concern. This method binds a Wi-Fi camera with its PUF (Physically Unclonable Function)-based identity, a solution of which is inevitable to connect with the receiver PC and thus depriving an attacker of the access to the PC. For more information, please visit the link: http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/software/iit-kgp-develops-solution-to-check-hacking-into-iot-devices/articleshow/60787421.cms

The IITs have revoked a ban, which they had imposed on 30 companies, mostly start-ups, barring them from participating in their campus placements.

The decision to revoke the ban was taken unanimously on Wednesday at a meeting of the All-IIT Placement Committee (AIPC).

The AIPC had blacklisted these companies, including healthcare services provider Portea Medical, food-tech company Zomato and online seller of baby-care products Hopscotch, in August 2016, after they withdrew the job offers they had made to the students.

Source: http://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/iits-revoke-year-old-campus-placement-ban-on-30-companies-117092101023_1.html

|| Google Code Jam ||
As you might be aware, Google is conducting Kickstart 2017 ( https://code.google.com/codejam/kickstart/ ) (formerly known as the APAC University Test), a 2Code Jam competition for university students to improve their technical skills and apply for career opportunities with Google. The next round is scheduled for September 24th.

1) Prepare with a codelab (duration ~2-3 hours)
We've prepared a small codelab (a tutorial combining explanation, working example code, and code exercise) to cover some basic algorithms which will help in the upcoming Code Jam Kickstart (CJK) rounds. Even if you do not plan to participate in the upcoming rounds, the codelab should help brush up basics for other algorithmic contests and interviews. 

For the codelab, you would need an internet connection and basic programming skills in a language of your choice, and of course, a little enthusiasm and energy to get through the codelab. We recommend having facilitators (a faculty or a fellow student) who can help if needed, and pursue the codelab as a group exercise. If you're a facilitator, it would be nice to brush up some combinatorics, dynamic programming (DP) and geometry skills. The time it would take a student to finish the codelab would depend on their current understanding and skill, but to err on the safe side, be ready to put in 2-3 hours.

2) Sign-up for the Codelab by 20th Sep
Please sign-up via this form ( https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScXuYa3JLlJPSd7xkyVpflIwiqwjsg9TPo9WSCenthdDEG6nQ/viewform ) and we will send you the codelab material via email. We recommend that you work on the codelab in groups so that it's both fun and you can learn from one another. And plan on having a facilitator (a faculty or a fellow student) who can help if needed.

Feedback/Questions
When we send the codelab via email, we will also send a link to a feedback form. Any concepts that are difficult or if you have questions about specific problems, please share/ask via the feedback form. We will address them as part of a livestream that we are hosting in the first week of October.

Post September 24th
We will host a Youtube livestream, in which we'll cover questions/concepts asked in the codelab exercise, discuss problems from a previous CJK round, common tips and tricks, strategies and general Q&A regarding CJK. We will share the livestream link with everyone who signs up for the codelab.
​
​Looking forward to an active participation.​ 
*We or similar pronouns refer to Google.

​
​Looking forward to an active participation.​ 
*We or similar pronouns refer to Google.

|| Google Code Jam ||
As you might be aware, Google is conducting Kickstart 2017 ( https://code.google.com/codejam/kickstart/ ) (formerly known as the APAC University Test), a 2Code Jam competition for university students to improve their technical skills and apply for career opportunities with Google. The next round is scheduled for September 24th.

1) Prepare with a codelab (duration ~2-3 hours)
We've prepared a small codelab (a tutorial combining explanation, working example code, and code exercise) to cover some basic algorithms which will help in the upcoming Code Jam Kickstart (CJK) rounds. Even if you do not plan to participate in the upcoming rounds, the codelab should help brush up basics for other algorithmic contests and interviews. 

For the codelab, you would need an internet connection and basic programming skills in a language of your choice, and of course, a little enthusiasm and energy to get through the codelab. We recommend having facilitators (a faculty or a fellow student) who can help if needed, and pursue the codelab as a group exercise. If you're a facilitator, it would be nice to brush up some combinatorics, dynamic programming (DP) and geometry skills. The time it would take a student to finish the codelab would depend on their current understanding and skill, but to err on the safe side, be ready to put in 2-3 hours.

2) Sign-up for the Codelab by 20th Sep
Please sign-up via this form ( https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScXuYa3JLlJPSd7xkyVpflIwiqwjsg9TPo9WSCenthdDEG6nQ/viewform ) and we will send you the codelab material via email. We recommend that you work on the codelab in groups so that it's both fun and you can learn from one another. And plan on having a facilitator (a faculty or a fellow student) who can help if needed.

Feedback/Questions
When we send the codelab via email, we will also send a link to a feedback form. Any concepts that are difficult or if you have questions about specific problems, please share/ask via the feedback form. We will address them as part of a livestream that we are hosting in the first week of October.

Post September 24th
We will host a Youtube livestream, in which we'll cover questions/concepts asked in the codelab exercise, discuss problems from a previous CJK round, common tips and tricks, strategies and general Q&A regarding CJK. We will share the livestream link with everyone who signs up for the codelab.
​
​Looking forward to an active participation.​ 
*We or similar pronouns refer to Google.

The campus has seen a grave concern over LAN and WiFi speed from the beginning of this semester and recently, a petition regarding the same on change.org has also been doing rounds. And many students have also emailed their grievances to CIC. Here's what CIC Network Support team has replied with:

Dear All,
This is in connection with the recent performance of campus network, especially the response time of internet access. We have received some emails from students of different halls regarding the slow response of internet access. Our team also started visiting all Halls to check the response time via LAN as well as wireless. Depending on the problem observed we will take care all of them individually and try to sort out at the earliest.
In view of the above, you are requested to send emails regarding the network accessibility issues, slightly in details, observed in your Hall to helpdesk@cc.iitkgp.ernet.in. It may be in any particular wing/ rooms/area or may be in LAN/Wi-Fi in some of the rooms, mentioning room nos./contact nos. etc. It will help us to identify and solve the issues in each and every hall separately.

We hope that this issue will be resolved at the earliest! Students are requested to send emails stating their concern as directed above.

"निज भाषा उन्नति अहै ,सब उन्नति को मूल।
बिन निज भाषा ज्ञान के ,मिटै न हिय को शूल ।।"
                                                         -भारतेन्दु हरिश्चंद्र 
पाश्चात्य सभ्यता को अपनाने का मतलब अपनी सभ्यता को भूलना नहीं होता। हिंदी हमारी अपनी भाषा है और इसकी उन्नति हमारे समाज और हमारी संस्कृति की उन्नति का परिचायक है। 
आवाज़ परिवार की ओर से हिंदी दिवस की शुभकामनाएं!

Professor Amiya Mohanty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been elected as a fellow of the Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) with effect from 1st November 2017. He completed his Ph.D. from University of Kentucky and joined the institute in 1996. A total of 36 Indian and 5 foreign fellows have been elected this year. Presently INAE has 794 Indian and 74 foreign fellows.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates him!

Just a day after we were left pondering over the decline of the Graduate Employability Ranking of IIT Kharagpur, the institute has declared in a press release that there have been more than 200 pre-placement offers from multinational companies to its students. The likes of Goldman Sachs, Samsung, Qualcomm, Texas Instruments, Adobe Systems and Wipro have offered more than 10 PPOs each. "This is an encouraging sign for us that companies recognize our students' hard work and motivation during the internship," said Prof. Debasis Deb, Professor in-charge of the Career Development Centre at IIT Kharagpur. The students have indeed boosted the reputation of the institute among the employers.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates the students and wishes all final year students all the best for the placements.
Source:http://www.business-standard.com/article/education/iit-kharagpur-bags-200-plus-pre-placement-offers-in-top-mncs-117091301023_1.html

By 2022, one-third of students across Indian Institutes of Technology (IIT) should be women and that’s the aim for the current government in its mission to empower women and rectify the gender imbalance across top science and engineering institutes across the country. Right now, women make up just about 8 % of the student population across the 23 IITs.
Department of Science and Technology is going to hold camps at the district levels to teach 50,000 senior secondary girls for IIT JEE as well as convince their parents.

Source: https://theprint.in/2017/09/12/modi-govts-agenda-2022-33-per-cent-iit-students-must-women/

हिंदी दिवस के अवसर पर राजभाषा विभाग के द्वारा आयोजित की जा रही निबंध लेखन प्रतियोगिता और अतिथि व्याख्यान में आप सभी सादर आमंत्रित हैं।
निबंध लेखन प्रतियोगिता का विषय है - 'मेक इन इंडिया' दौर के विकासशील भारत में हिंदी का स्वरुप एवं भविष्य।
साथ ही आईआईटी खड़गपुर के भूतपूर्व छात्र एवं प्रसिद्ध जल वैज्ञानिक डॉ. दिनेश कुमार मिश्र [1968/बीटेक/सिविल] से मिलने और विचारों के आदान-प्रदान का भी अवसर प्राप्त होगा। वे अतिथि व्याख्यान में भारत की नदियों के भाषिक, सांस्कृतिक एवं वैज्ञानिक महत्व पर अपने बहुमूल्य विचार प्रस्तुत करेंगे।
दिनांक: 14 सितम्बर 2017
समय: 9:00 बजे पूर्वाह्न 
स्थान: एस एन बोस ऑडिटोरियम

साथ ही आईआईटी खड़गपुर के भूतपूर्व छात्र एवं प्रसिद्ध जल वैज्ञानिक डॉ. दिनेश कुमार मिश्र [1968/बीटेक/सिविल] से मिलने और विचारों के आदान-प्रदान का भी अवसर प्राप्त होगा। वे अतिथि व्याख्यान में भारत की नदियों के भाषिक, सांस्कृतिक एवं वैज्ञानिक महत्व पर अपने बहुमूल्य विचार प्रस्तुत करेंगे।
दिनांक: 14 सितम्बर 2017
समय: 9:00 बजे पूर्वाह्न 
स्थान: एस एन बोस ऑडिटोरियम

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. As the first initiative in the student welfare portfolio, the Technology Students' Gymkhana in association with Counselling Center, IIT Kharagpur organised a 2 day workshop on Gatekeepers training which helped students gain knowledge about detection of people with problems and how they should interact with them. The event saw a participation of around 65 students representing various halls of residences and Student Welfare Group, IIT Kharagpur. The event ended with paying condolences to the colleagues we lost last year and Prof.Somesh Kumar interacted with the students and discussed about the vision to work together for a better KGP.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 29 new photos — with Sairam Alla and 32 others.
message:
The 65th Inter Hall Athletics came to a splendid end with miraculous performances by the athletes and saw a smooth conduction throughout all three days. The closing ceremony started with medal distributions, followed by the announcement of Best Athletes and final Hall standings. And it ended with National Anthem.
The event saw the esteemed presence of dignitaries like Dean (UGS), Dean of Students' Affairs and President (TSG) who gave away the medals to athletes and lifted their spirits.
Also, some of the scenes on the ground were testimony of the sportsman spirit that we KGPians have. While dignitaries were awarding Abin, Sairam, Gaurav and many more athletes the medals, each and every member of all the hall teams gave them standing ovation in unison! It definitely speaks volumes about the sportsman spirit that we have developed over the years, given some unfortunate events that happened last semester.
We would like to thank each and every stakeholder who was involved in the smooth conduction of the meet including General Secretaries, Professor In-Charge, ground staffs, staff members from District Council of School Sports and Games (Midnapur) and all others.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
Open IIT 2017-18 || Postering
The Open IIT Postering Competition saw an active participation from the students. Participants were provided three topics, 'The​ ​Power​ ​of ​Positivity', 'Being Beautiful', 'Essence of Peace', out of which they had to choose any one. The results are as follows:- 

First - Bandana Badu (SN/IG)-  90/100 
Second - Chaitanya Shinde (RK)-  84/100
Third -  Amlan Kumar Sahu (Nehru) and Brahma Deen (JCB)- 80/100

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners!

|| Best Athletes ||
Today was the 3rd and final day of 65th Inter-Hall Athletics Meet. The day concluded on a high with some really inspirational performances. Throughout the day, the athletes participated with never-ending zeal. Though all of them put their hearts out, few stood above all and were awarded as the best athletes in their respective categories. They are as follows:-

Men's Senior- Abin Devassia
Women's Senior- Dimple Kapadia
Men's Junior- Eslavath Jaga Deesh
Women's Junior- Hima Swetha

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates all of them!

With the declaration of 65th Interhall Athletics Meet open, a magnanimous participation was witnessed in all the events. The stadium experienced decent turnout of the crowd cheering for their Halls of Residence. Yesterday, it all started with Junior Men & Women events in 800 meters. SN Hall of Residence performed exceptionally well by bagging a total of 3 medals in Junior Women category. MS Hall, the defending champions of GC Athletics Men, left everyone speechless by securing a total of 5 medals, all the three in the senior category and gold & silver in the junior category. Manish Singh Rana (MMM Hall) managed to win the gold for his hall of residence in both 800 m and 1500 m. Lokesh Reddi and Gaurav Shenoy were among the few names who secured medals in every event they participated and left no stone unturned to contribute towards the sport. Among girls, Bharti Kushal Sharma, Dimple Kapadia, and Hima Swetha showed outstanding performances. In Men JR category, Sagar Kongari, Eslavatha Jaga Deesh, and Sumit Gaurav have shown exceptional performances by winning more than one medal for their respective halls.

MS Hall continues its legacy in GC Athletics by scoring a sum of 53 points on Day 1 and Day 2. According to the current tally of points, the competition for the second position is too fierce with the difference of just one point between RP (14 Points) and LBS (13 Points). In GC Athletics women’s category, SN Hall of Residence is leading others with 30 points. Junior events, however, with the contribution of no points in General Championship, were also quite successful with the active participation in Men’s category.

With the showcase of such fine performances, we expect the events will exhibit the same enthusiasm and sportsmanship and Day 3 will witness wonders. Here are the comprehensive results of events till now.

September 10th is World Suicide Prevention Day and to generate awareness around emotional and mental health, 'I Will' by EpsyClinic is presenting an interactive talk on "Normalizing mental health" with an objective to remove stigma regarding mental health and to share a solution with people suffering from emotional or mental health issues. 
Venue: SN Bose Auditorium
Time: 12 PM
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the students to come forward and attend the talk purposefully bringing those friends who show signs of depression by some means or the other and do your bit to make IIT KGP a better and happier place to live in.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
Freshers turned up in optimistic numbers for a tree plantation programme conducted in the Vikram Sarabhai Residential Complex. This plantation drive was organised under the latest phase of the induction programme activities. Students, divided into groups of four, planted different species of plants with the help of gardeners.
Dean(UGS), Prof S.K.Barai, was present throughout the two-hour programme to lift the spirits of the students.
Moreover, caps which read "The spirit of KGP" were distributed to showcase the essence of the activity.

Hello KGPians,
As you know and you might have observed as well that our team has been continuously putting up sincere efforts to make the results of all the events of ongoing Inter Hall Athletics Meet available for you all. We are trying to leave no stone unturned for the same. But unfortunately, most of the posts that were made today have been removed by Facebook mentioning them as 'spam'. Hence, you might not be able to see today's results which were up on our page a few hours ago. The inconvenience caused is deeply regretted. We are trying to re-post all the results. Meanwhile, if someone can provide suggestions regarding how those posts can be brought back, kindly contact us!
Stay tuned for all the updates. We will provide today's summary in a while. These hiccups are not going to dampen our journalistic spirits! We have always been dedicated to make the news reach to you all as soon as possible and we will keep doing that!

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos — at Jnan Ghosh Stadium, IIT Kharagpur.
message:
The 65th Inter Hall Athletics Meet, the first set of events of General Championship 2017-18, has been ceremonially declared open this morning by Prof. Somesh Kumar, Dean SA.The ceremony started with the hoisting of the flag followed by the march past by the athletes of all the halls participating in the meet. The march past was led by Lokeshwara Rao Reddi carrying the IIT flag.  The athletes then took oath of following the sportsman spirit which was administered by Manish Datta, GSec Sports And Games,TSG. Prof. William Kumar Mohanty, President, TSG  and Prof. Somesh Kumar addressed the students and applauded the enthusiasm shown by the students to promote sports in the campus. 
Stay tuned to our page for the updates.

The march past was led by Lokeshwara Rao Reddi carrying the IIT flag.  The athletes then took oath of following the sportsman spirit which was administered by Manish Datta, GSec Sports And Games,TSG. Prof. William Kumar Mohanty, President, TSG  and Prof. Somesh Kumar addressed the students and applauded the enthusiasm shown by the students to promote sports in the campus. 
Stay tuned to our page for the updates.

Professor Aritra Hazra, Assistant Professor of Computer Science & Engineering Department, IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the prestigious INAE Young Engineer Award 2017. He has joined the department from August 2017 and has previously served at IIT Madras. 

Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) was established in 1987 to promote the advancement of and excellence in the field of engineering and technology and related science and disciplines and the purpose of the INAE Young Engineer Award is to recognize outstanding achievements contributions made by Young Engineers in any branch of engineering.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor!

Students of IIT Kharagpur to organize a PAN India Competition called “Young Innovators' Program (YIP)” on technology ideation for young innovators from school.
The competition would be conducted by Branding and Relations Cell (BARC), IIT Kharagpur for students belonging to 8th to 10th standard. It would cover major aspects such as Energy, Agriculture, Food, Environment, Hardware Modelling and Biotechnology. Teams from across various locations in India would be competing. It is supposed to harness the creativity of hundreds of bright young minds to apply their scientific knowledge to real life problems and come up with digital yet sustainable innovative solutions.The students would get a chance to explore the scientific environment within and an opportunity to present their projects in front of distinguished researchers. The program comprises of three rounds,  the second round has already been started and the submissions will be accepted until 10th September. The final round is scheduled to be held at IIT Kharagpur, this year on 28th and 29th October.
For more information, visit http://www.barc.iitkgp.ac.in/yip/

Just after a slip in the QS and THE world rankings, the IITs received a huge setback when the Finance Ministry turned down the proposal of MHRD to allocate Rs 8,700 crores to enhance their global standings. The Finance Ministry was of the opinion that the premiere institutes should first address “fundamental issues” such as the autonomy to fix fees, raising resources from corporate houses and alumni members, and strengthening existing schemes. 
Under Project Vishwajeet, which was cleared last year by the IIT council, the top seven IITs were supposed to use the funds (Rs 1,250 crores each over a five-year period) to upgrade their infrastructure, hire foreign faculty members, tie up with international institutions and adopt a host of other measures for improving their QS and Times global institution rankings. As no Indian Institute could make it into top 200, it certainly proved that things were not going right and there were points to ponder over!
In its note, the finance ministry also recommended that the human resource development ministry should ask IITs to construct world-class laboratories through existing grants or the recently launched Institute of Eminence scheme. Under the Institute of Eminence scheme, 10 select government institutes will be given approximately Rs 1,000 crores. "The finance ministry has suggested that the IITs should compete for that scheme instead of expecting funds through the Vishwajeet project,” an official said.
Source: http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/earn-it-don-t-expect-it-govt-junks-funding-project-to-iits-instead-says-compete-for-grant/story-NZCMnzbs3y2niSfLe17abK.html

Just after a slip in the QS and THE world rankings, the IITs received a huge setback when the Finance Ministry turned down the proposal of MHRD to allocate Rs 8,700 crores to enhance their global standings. The Finance Ministry was of the opinion that the premiere institutes should first address “fundamental issues” such as the autonomy to fix fees, raising resources from corporate houses and alumni members, and strengthening existing schemes. 
Under Project Vishwajeet, which was cleared last year by the IIT council, the top seven IITs were supposed to use the funds (Rs 1,250 crores each over a five-year period) to upgrade their infrastructure, hire foreign faculty members, tie up with international institutions and adopt a host of other measures for improving their QS and Times global institution rankings. As no Indian Institute could make it into top 200, it certainly proved that things were not going right and there were points to ponder over!
In its note, the finance ministry also recommended that the human resource development ministry should ask IITs to construct world-class laboratories through existing grants or the recently launched Institute of Eminence scheme. Under the Institute of Eminence scheme, 10 select government institutes will be given approximately Rs 1,000 crores. "The finance ministry has suggested that the IITs should compete for that scheme instead of expecting funds through the Vishwajeet project,” an official said.
Source: http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/earn-it-don-t-expect-it-govt-junks-funding-project-to-iits-instead-says-compete-for-grant/story-NZCMnzbs3y2niSfLe17abK.html

The Times Higher Education (THE) rankings 2018 of the world’s top 1,000 universities in 77 countries was published yesterday and didn't pan out well for Indian institutions. Most of the Indian Institutes dropped down the ranking list as compared to previous year. Indian Institute of Science (IISc) slipped from the 201-250 band to 251-300. IIT Delhi, Kanpur and Madras came down to the 501–600 band from last year’s 401-500 rankings. IIT Kharagpur remained in 501-600 band as was the case last year.

Times Higher Education attributed this dismal showing to “drops in research influence score and research income,” and said most of the institutes “performed poorly on the internationalisation pillar.” The number of international students coming into India was limited. International scholars also were not being hired for long-term faculty positions.

“China, Hong Kong and Singapore all invest very heavily in their university systems. This year, almost all universities in the three regions improved their standing in the ranking, signalling that their commitment to investment has bolstered results year-on-year,” Phil Baty, editorial director, Global Rankings, THE, said. He said that things were likely to improve because of the “really positive news in that India’s overall research income and research quality has risen this year, and the country’s world class university plan shows that it recognises the importance of investing in higher education.”

Here. we present to you a comparison of QS Rankings and THE Rankings of 2017 as well as 2018.
Source: http://www.livemint.com/Education/EtUBYaH5PAde3y1u325PKO/THE-World-University-Rankings-2018-IISC-slides-no-Indian-i.html

The results of Online Poetry (English) Writing Competition organized by the Technology Students' Gymkhana are out.  Names of the winners and the link to their beautiful creations are as follows:-
1st Position – “Limns of a Beautiful Time” by Naresh R. (Link-https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5s-DJMXAKY4SmItSnBscnI1UXM/view)
2nd Position- “In search of truth” by Akhil Bharti Mohan. (Link- https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B3oqSE87PT_NRzY5STFXYVpTQjQ/view )
3rd Position- “Now you'll know why” by Akshay Jain. (Link- https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxCwLmnfcgdPRTBPLTEwSjA2em8/view)
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners! This is an appreciable move by Technology Students’ Gymkhana to organize such competitions for budding writing talents and we expect that such competitions for Hindi enthusiasts will also be organized in future.

Recently, the four co-founders of "Make The World Wonderful" i.e., Meghana Dabbara, Saumya Katuri, Khyathi Chodagiri and Pranita Garimella visited IIT Kharagpur and we were blessed to have such beautiful people in our campus. Their visit was followed by a guest lecture by them at Kalidas auditorium. Meanwhile, we got the privilege to talk to them and get to know their mind. They descriptively talked about their experience in KGP, their idea, journey, obstacles, and expectations.
Make the World Wonderful is an NGO, a civil society organization that aims to build harmony in society. They primarily work with children and youth, because they believe that when equipped with proper values and skills, youngers have the power to bring about positive social change.
At the core, they have a dedicated team of four young 18-year old girls, working towards fulfilling their vision of the harmonious world. Make The World Wonderful is a pilot project of iB Hubs, a Pan-India Startup Hub. With the constant support and guidance, they have formed multiple support teams, such as the Society Body, Technical Support Team, Administrative support team and so on. To know more, you can visit: http://maketheworldwonderful.org/

(Do pardon us for a slight lag in voice in the latter part of the video)

How would you feel when someone takes an initiative to make you feel happy? And what if that is taken by none other than the government? Yes, you read it right! The government is going to take an initiative to make people feel happy. The state government has come to terms with IIT Kharagpur's Rekhi Centre of Excellence for Science of Happiness for the development of Happiness Index. After taking few steps like fixing parameters of happiness index with surveys, which is to be conducted by IIT KGP in assistance with state government, the latter will start this initiative. Manohar Dubey, Chief Executive Officer of Rajya Anand Sansthan, said that the survey will start within a month. Under this initiative in Madhya Pradesh, over 115 Anand Clubs have been opened with the objective being to ensure "happiness in lives of the common man".
Source: http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bhopal/tell-government-the-secret-to-your-happiness/articleshow/60353674.cms

"गुरू कुम्हार शिष कुंभ है, गढि़ गढि़ काढ़ै खोट।
अन्तर हाथ सहार दै, बाहर बाहै चोट।।"
Famous Hindi Poet Kabirdas says, "A teacher is actually a potter who very cautiously turns a lump of soil into a beautiful pot. His outer behaviour may be a little bit tough in order to teach us with discipline, but his inner love for his students is sumptuous. Just like a potter hits the under-construction pot from outside, but one hand is always inside it to support it."
हमें  कच्ची मिटटी की ढेर से पक्का घड़ा बनाने की कवायद करने वाले कुम्भकार को हमारा शत शत नमन! 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the members of teaching Community a Happy Teacher's Day.

His outer behaviour may be a little bit tough in order to teach us with discipline, but his inner love for his students is sumptuous. Just like a potter hits the under-construction pot from outside, but one hand is always inside it to support it."
हमें  कच्ची मिटटी की ढेर से पक्का घड़ा बनाने की कवायद करने वाले कुम्भकार को हमारा शत शत नमन! Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the members of teaching Community a Happy Teacher's Day.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 5 new photos.
message:
In what seemed to many a not-so-anticipated as well as surprisingly pleasant gesture, the campus was abuzz with the talks of Zakir Khan being in the campus doing the rounds yesterday! Slowly and steadily, the news broke out and KGPians were all excited to get a glimpse of the rising star of Indian Comedy i.e., Zakir Khan, popularly known as "Sakht Launda" whose heart never melts, no matter what! 

In a unique and first of its own kind of initiative, Vice President (Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur) i.e., Mayank Srivastava under the tutelage of TSG had contacted Zakir Khan requesting him to pay a visit to our campus. And he accepted it gleefully. There have been incidents of many celebrities visiting the campus but this one was something that KGP has never witnessed before! You come out of your room and take a stroll towards the entrance gate only to find Zakir Khan in front of you! You rub your eyes in disbelief but finally, you realize that it's reality! Needless to say, this has been an epic experience for many.

He visited Nehru Hall of Residence and interacted with students. A lot of funny moments and light conversations followed. Students were visibly excited and pleased to the core. Zakir didn't let the moment slip and tried his hands on bat-ball making it a "moment-hai-bhai-moment-hai" moment! There were plans to visit LLR hall as well but unfortunately, he wasn't able to.
Though he was here for a short period of time, he left behind smiles on hundreds of faces and that's what was the motive behind this initiative. In last one year, our campus has seen some unfortunate events happening and this was the perfect plan to boost the dampening spirit of the people.

We would like to thank all the stakeholders who were involved in this, especially VP, TSG who put all their efforts to execute this idea. We, on the behalf of entire campus, would also like to thank Zakir Khan from the core of our hearts for taking out some time of his busy schedule and making this campus livelier with his presence.

The online registration process for Joint Admission Test(JAM) for admission in M.Sc. courses in IITs and IISc is scheduled to begin from tomorrow i.e, September 5th, 2018. IIT Bombay is the convener of this coveted entrance examination this year. The deadline for the registration is October 10th and the examination is scheduled to be conducted on February 11th, 2018. The registration form for the same can be found at jam.iitb.ac.in. The detailed information regarding tentative schedule can be obtained through the attachment.

आईआईटी एवं आईआईएससी के MSc कोर्सेज में दाखिले के लिए संचालित किये जाने वाले जॉइंट एडमिशन टेस्ट (JAM  2018) के लिए ऑनलाइन रजिस्ट्रेशन प्रक्रिया की शुरुआत कल, 5 सितम्बर ,से शुरू होगी । इस वर्ष यह प्रवेश परीक्षा आईआईटी मुंबई द्वारा आयोजित की जा रही है । रजिस्ट्रेशन करने की अंतिम तिथि 10 अक्टूबर है तथा परीक्षा की तिथि 11 फरवरी,2018 निर्धारित की गयी है । रजिस्ट्रेशन के लिए इस लिंक पर जाएँ- jam.iitb.ac.in । कुछ अन्य महत्त्वपूर्ण तिथियां संलग्न चित्र में देखी जा सकती  हैं ।

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 16 new photos — with Vinit Kumawat and 3 others.
message: Teachers’ Day was celebrated in Netaji Auditorium today from 6 pm onwards. The event was organized by the Radha Krishnan Hall of Residence, with an appreciable attendance comprised of cultural performances by the students as well as the professors of the Institute. The students were privileged to have Professor Joy Sen on stage, playing the Sitar. Vocal performances were also delivered by Professor Seema Singh, Professor Anandrup Bhattacharya, and Professor P. Sandilya. Students presented a dance performance along with a play- 'The Third Wave' describing how an ideology strongly affects the society - be it in a positive or negative way. Some students gave solo performances as well. Also, the winners of the sketching competition held in the morning were awarded. The event came to an end with an address by the warden of the RK Hall. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur looks forward to having such successful events in future too.

Continuing the tradition, Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence is celebrating the Teacher’s Day today at 6:00 pm in Netaji Auditorium. The event is being held today owing to an absence of holiday on 5th September. Last year, the function experienced very little attendance. Researchers from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications, IIT Kharagpur have developed a visual technology that enables safer driving during rains. The technology removes from real-time video the obscuring effects of rain and displays it on the windscreen of vehicles to increase the clarity of driver’s view. Thus, it aims to enhance the transportation safety by providing on-screen visualization of clear videos in typical conditions.

As directed by Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, IIT Kharagpur is celebrating 70 years of Independence and 75 years of Quit India Movement (SANKALP SE SIDDHI: Yeh India ka Time Hai) tomorrow, 2nd September 2017, at Netaji Auditorium. Tomorrow, there will be Manthan programme followed by a rock concert. Manthan programme will be from 4 pm to 5 pm. It is a brain-storming session/panel discussion on the theme 'New India 2022'. Rock concert will be from 6 pm to 8 pm. All the KGPians are cordially invited to witness the programme.

The students of the Department of Architecture & Regional Planning - IIT Kharagpur have come up with a unique idea of tackling the problem of making choices which make us feel happy. 
The Project titled “Happiness Project: What Made Me” is one among the three submissions from IIT Kharagpur for the prestigious Annual NASA Design Competition (ANDC). The problem statement was “We often turn a blind eye to unused/disused public spaces around us. Can Schools of Architecture create a positive social impact on these derelict urban spaces, by redesigning alternative spaces to have a larger social impact and to rebuild and improve them with small interventions?”
Our team found out the details about the project and have formulated the same in this report. Do give it a read.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/wme.php

Hello KGPians!
Examination Time Table for the upcoming Mid-Semester exam is out! The exam is scheduled to start on September 15th (Friday) and will end on September 25th (Monday). You can find the time table on your ERP --> Academic --> Examination Time Table --> Supplementary Examination TimeTable. 
It should have come with the link "Examination Time Table (for Students), but due to some technical glitch, it's coming with the link "Supplementary Examination TimeTable".
Alternatively, you can find the same here as well: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_0JVL_SZENRZjZxQjVkS1QzZmM/view?usp=sharing

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the examinees all the best!

The online registration process for GATE 2018 is scheduled to start from today i.e., September 1st by Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati. IIT Guwahati is the organizing institute of the coveted entrance exam this year. The last date for registration is October 5th. The exam is going to be held in February next year and the result is scheduled to be released on March 17th, 2018.Registration link:http://appsgate.iitg.ac.in 
GATE 2018 के लिए ऑनलाइन रजिस्ट्रेशन प्रक्रिया की शुरुआत आज, 1 सितम्बर, से होगी । इस वर्ष यह प्रवेश परीक्षा आईआईटी गुवाहाटी द्वारा आयोजित की जा रही है । रजिस्ट्रेशन करने की अंतिम तिथि 5 अक्टूबर निर्धारित की गयी है । परीक्षा का आयोजन अगले वर्ष फरवरी माह में किया जायेगा तथा परिणाम-घोषणा की तिथि 17 मार्च, 2018 निर्धारित की गयी है । रजिस्ट्रेशन के लिए इस लिंक पर जाएँ- http://appsgate.iitg.ac.in तथा अधिक जानकारी के लिए इस लिंक पर जाएं-  http://gate.iitg.ac.in

Prof. Nirupama Mallick has been appointed as the Head of Agricultural and Food Engineering Department as well as Rural Development Centre with effect from Sept 1, 2017. She joined the institute in 2000. She has many awards and honours to her name including Alexander von Humboldt Fellowship (1997) and Woman Scientist Medal by Biotech Research Society of India (2005). Also, she is Indian National Science Academy (INSA) fellow.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Prof. Nirupama Mallick and wishes her all the best!

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Shreyans Sadangi and 2 others.
message:
Students of IIT Kharagpur have again shown their mettle in quizzing and have made the quizzing circle across the country feel their dominant presence. A team of three IIT Kharagpur students Piyush Kedia, Shreyans Sadangi and Amit Kumar Ram won the recently concluded Kolkata regionals of Sweden India Nobel Memorial Quiz and advanced to the finals to be conducted on 11th October in Delhi. Out of more than 60 teams that participated in the regional round, only 6 teams made it to the finals. This quiz is conducted in 11 cities across India. In 2015 also, a team from IIT Kharagpur had won the Kolkata regionals. The stellar performance of KGPians can be gauged from the fact that all four teams from KGP actually advanced to the finals, but the rules had a stipulation that only one team from each college can be allowed to advance to the finals.
The Embassy of Sweden organises one of India’s most prestigious quiz contests annually – The Sweden-India Nobel Memorial Quiz. The quiz series is part of the Sweden India Nobel Memorial Week – now in its eleventh year. 
The broad theme of the quiz is Alfred Nobel and his life and achievements, the Nobel Prize, Nobel Laureates and their achievements, Sweden, its people and their culture, Swedish innovations and inventions. Members of the winning team win a week-long visit to Sweden where they will visit Swedish companies, universities and the Nobel Museum. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them for their marvellous performance and wishes them all the best for finals!

Picture Credits - Sweden in India

A team of three IIT Kharagpur students Piyush Kedia, Shreyans Sadangi and Amit Kumar Ram won the recently concluded Kolkata regionals of Sweden India Nobel Memorial Quiz and advanced to the finals to be conducted on 11th October in Delhi. Out of more than 60 teams that participated in the regional round, only 6 teams made it to the finals. This quiz is conducted in 11 cities across India. In 2015 also, a team from IIT Kharagpur had won the Kolkata regionals. The stellar performance of KGPians can be gauged from the fact that all four teams from KGP actually advanced to the finals, but the rules had a stipulation that only one team from each college can be allowed to advance to the finals.
The Embassy of Sweden organises one of India’s most prestigious quiz contests annually – The Sweden-India Nobel Memorial Quiz. The quiz series is part of the Sweden India Nobel Memorial Week – now in its eleventh year. 
The broad theme of the quiz is Alfred Nobel and his life and achievements, the Nobel Prize, Nobel Laureates and their achievements, Sweden, its people and their culture, Swedish innovations and inventions. Members of the winning team win a week-long visit to Sweden where they will visit Swedish companies, universities and the Nobel Museum. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them for their marvellous performance and wishes them all the best for finals!

Picture Credits - Sweden in India

Capillary brings you its first Machine Learning and App Development Hackathon exclusively for IIT Kharagpur students. Applications from individuals and teams (2 or 3 members) are invited for this two-fold competition. Problem statement has already been released and the submission deadline is 3rd September. 
Exciting cash prizes and opportunities for on campus internships with capillary are waiting for you. All you have to do is to register yourself or your team at skillenza’s platform to have the complete access to their learning resources and contests. Registration along with participation is completely free of cost.

Note:- Extension in deadline. The earlier deadline was 27th August which has now changed to 3rd September. Interested students don't miss the opportunity. 

For more information, visit https://beta.skillenza.com/challenge/iitkgp_datascienceinterns

#Know_Your_Professor
In this series of KYP, we are going to take you to a rather young professor who is again an alumnus of our institution- Professor Debalay Chakrabarti. He joined the Institute in 2008 and is presently an associate professor in Metallurgical and Materials Engineering Department. He is also delivering his services as the UG Co-ordinator and a member of the UGPEC, one of the institute level Senate sub-committees.
Read the full article at:
http://bit.ly/debalay_chakrabarti

In a news that comes as an utter shock to the entire KGP community, Prof. Joydip Bhattacharjee (Ocean Engg and Naval Architecture) is sadly no more among us. He got drowned in a large water filled ditch today while trying to rescue his 4-year-old child who had fallen into the water body near the campus. Local people took him and his son out of the water and took them to the hospital where he was declared brought dead while his son has been released after first aid. He had gone out for a ride with his son and daughter to Kharagpur's Gholgeria where the accident happened. According to witnesses, the son accidentally fell into the water and Dr. Bhattacharjee jumped in to save him.

Entire KGP community mourns the untimely loss of such a talented and beloved professor. We extended our deep condolences to his family and hope that our prayers will give them the strength to bear this huge loss.

Source: http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kgp-professor-gets-drowned-trying-to-save-son-117082700503_1.html

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message: Khoj'17 - the annual treasure hunt event exclusively for freshers, was organized successfully in the evening yesterday by Azad Hall of Residence. In this campus wide event that was mainly about enjoyment, winning prizes, cycling long distances, getting to know the batch-mates and the serene campus - all while cracking clues after clues and searching for the right codes! Initially, it was the rain which threatened to play spoilsport but with time, the weather got better and better. About 170 teams participated with great zeal and enthusiasm along with the tinge of smile and excitement that was visible on their faces. The theme of the event was Video Games of the 90's and it surely gave freshers the moment to go back to that era and live their dream again!

मानव संसाधन विकास मंत्रालय (भारत सरकार) ने यह निर्णय लिया है कि सभी इंजीनियरिंग कॉलेजों में प्रवेश के लिए एक संयुक्त प्रवेश परीक्षा का विचार अगले वर्ष धरातल पर नहीं उतर पायेगा | हालाँकि उन्होंने पूरे विचार को एक सिरे से खारिज नहीं किया है, बल्कि आगे इस पर चर्चा जारी रहेगी | गौरतलब हो कि ऑल इंडिया कौंसिल ऑफ़ टेक्निकल एजुकेशन ने इस वर्ष मार्च में वर्ष 2018 से इंजीनियरिंग संस्थानों में नामांकन हेतु राष्ट्रीय स्तर पर एक संयुक्त प्रवेश करवाने की बात कही थी | कौंसिल अभी भी इस विचार की संभावनाओं पर चर्चा कर रही है | ज्ञातव्य हो कि जेईई के अलावा बहुत सारे प्रदेश और निजी संस्थान स्वयं ही अपनी अपनी प्रवेश परीक्षा आयोजित करते हैं | 

The HRD Ministry has decided to put the plans of introducing a common engineering entrance exam from next year on hold. Earlier, the All India Council of Technical Education (AICTE) had announced in March that a national-level common entrance examination for engineering colleges would be conducted from the next academic year in 2018. However, the idea has not been completely discarded. Apart from JEE, a number of states conduct their own tests where as several private colleges also conduct their own entrance examinations.

साभार: http://www.hindustantimes.com/education/no-common-engineering-entrance-exams-hrd-drops-plans/story-oUj4pqcKZIavpwa8VupPYN.html

The entrance examination for the prestigious Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) i.e., JEE Advanced will go completely online from 2018. Joint Admission Board (JAB), which is the policymaking body on IIT admissions, took this decision in a meeting on 20th August.
IIT Madras director and JAB 2017 chairman Prof. Bhaskar Ramamurthi said in a statement, “It has been decided that the JEE (Advanced) will be conducted in online mode from 2018 onwards. Further information regarding the examination will be provided by the JAB in due course.”
The HRD ministry had earlier introduced the option of taking the JEE Mains online. However, out of 13 lakh students who took the JEE Mains this year, less than 10% of them opted for online mode.

Source: http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/education/entrance-test-to-iits-to-completely-go-online-from-2018/articleshow/60146636.cms

IIT Madras director and JAB 2017 chairman Prof. Bhaskar Ramamurthi said in a statement, “It has been decided that the JEE (Advanced) will be conducted in online mode from 2018 onwards. Further information regarding the examination will be provided by the JAB in due course.”
The HRD ministry had earlier introduced the option of taking the JEE Mains online. However, out of 13 lakh students who took the JEE Mains this year, less than 10% of them opted for online mode.

Source: http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/education/entrance-test-to-iits-to-completely-go-online-from-2018/articleshow/60146636.cms

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
Anthill Creations, founded by five IIT Kharagpur alumni Nancy Charaya(ex-Chief Editor, Awaaz), Pooja Rai, Nupur Agrawal, Souradeep Paul and Vishesh Gupta (all 2015 - B.Arch.), is one of the eight early-stage non-profit startups selected for an 18-month incubation program by the NS Raghavan Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning (NSRCEL) at the Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Bangalore. The founders will also receive fellowship support of 18 lakh.
This is part of India's first-ever, non-profit startup incubator supported by the Michael and Susan Dell Foundation. The selected organizations are tackling some of the toughest challenges in education and skills among poor communities around the country.
Anthill Creations aims to build sustainable playscapes for children by using recyclable materials. The idea of Anthill Creations is to create the world where communities come together and active play becomes affordable and accessible to all. It works towards lighter, quicker and cheaper transformation of dead zones into interactive and sustainable playscapes from scrap tyres and recycled material by mobilizing the communities. Recycling non-biodegradable material like tyres, therefore, would not just help safeguard the environment but be cost effective as a building material too.
“Traditionally, mass produced recreational equipment for building a playground would cost a very high price, but since we are using material that is considered trash by some, we have been successful in setting up playgrounds for very cheap cost,” Souradeep had said in an interview.

With an aim to teach students the basic life science techniques, IIT Kharagpur is going to start Genomics Laboratory that would be first of its kind in India. The primary objective of the laboratory would be to teach all the students at the second year the basic techniques of life sciences that would include microscopy-based observation, molecular biology, protein structure and function and lastly, bioinformatics. Under the mentorship of faculties, from third year onwards, students would be allowed to plan and execute experiments by their own. The lab and its equipment for research would be available for the students for 24×7.

Prasanna Shrivastava, an IIT Kharagpur alumnus (Mechanical Engineering, 2005-09), has written this brilliant article in which he discusses various issues regarding what IITians do after graduation and has focused on certain myths as well. He ponders over various aspects backed with analysis of his own batch and in the process, breaks a few myths regarding IITians. It gives an insight to brain drain, the correlation between CGPA and entrepreneurial skills, IITians pursuing higher education, various roles through which they are contributing to the society etc.
Give it a read - https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/what-iitians-do-after-graduation-iit-system-prasanna-shrivastava?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_profile_view_base%3B0LjaPtSwSvGZ9nKPHfDHYA%3D%3D

In an unprecedented move, the Central government will provide Rs 70,000 as a monthly fellowship to those researchers doing their PhDs in IITs or IISc for a period of five years. At the 67th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur, Union higher education secretary Kewal Kumar Sharma said, “As part of the research fellowship scheme of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, we wish the meritorious students who are being forced to leave the country for purely financial reasons stay within the country. We will provide 2,000 such monthly fellowships across the IIT system and IISc Bengaluru. The cabinet nod for the proposal should come soon. We are hopeful to start it from the next session,”
Presently researcher-students get Rs 25,000 as monthly scholarship at IITs.

We believe that this will financially empower students having a keen interest in research to continue their work without being forced to opt for lucrative corporate jobs for higher pay.

Source: http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-central-fellowship-of-rs-70000-for-iit-phd-researchers-2535151

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 5 new photos.
message:
In an initiative of its own kind, “Staff Excellency Awards” were awarded to some of the staff members in Azad Hall of Residence on the eve of Independence Day for their exemplary service. Amongst the awardees, one was the Mess Supervisor who has been discharging his duty with discipline and commitment for several years. Even though his daily official work starts around 5.30 am, he has seldom been late. Another, a mess worker who lives 25 kilometers away from the campus, works till late in the night to clean the plates and has seldom been absent.
In an another good gesture, plantation drive was also organized on this eve and wardens of the same hall planted trees in the hall premises to send out the message regarding the dire need of planting more and more trees.

In the series of articles under 'Jewels of KGP', we introduce you all to Mr. Sikhar Patranabis who did his graduation in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Kharagpur (2011-15) and graduated with a staggering CGPA of 9.87 which also fetched him the President of India Gold Medal for the year 2015. The lure of a high-paying pre-placement job offer from Microsoft, however, could not distract him away from his passion for research. He is an IBM PhD Fellow at the Secured Embedded Architecture Laboratory, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur and currently pursuing his PhD under the supervision of Dr. Debdeep Mukhopadhyay.
In this interview, he talks about his KGP life, secret of his stellar academic performance, internship experiences, passion for research and much more about such things.
Give it a read...

Wanted to know how much CGPA does it take to get your branch changed at the end of the first year? Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur brings to you an extensive analysis of the Department Change statistics for the batch of 2016-17. DepC is one of the major goals for the first years who don't get their desired branch on the basis of JEE rank. The analysis consists of CGPA cut off for different branches, the number of students outgoing and incoming to a particular branch, comparison of cut offs for the year 2016 and 2017.
A total of 110 students got their branch changed this year. As expected, the cut off was highest for CSE i.e., 9.73. Read the full analysis here: 
http://awaaziitkgp.org/info.php?q=Depc.php

Thirteen students from the Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group (KRSSG) team represented the institute in the recently concluded RoboCup held in Nagoya (Japan). For qualification, they had submitted a video in the month of February and qualified for the final event.
RoboCup is an annual international robotics competition proposed and founded in 1997 with the aim of promoting robotics and AI research, by offering a publicly appealing, but formidable challenge. This year RoboCup was held in Nagoya, Japan. They participated in two leagues in RoboCup - Small Sized League and Humanoid Simulation League.
This year, it was their first participation in the Small Sized League and they faced a lot of technical difficulties. A total of twenty-four teams had qualified for the league, out of which only twenty could finally make it to the league. The twenty teams were divided into four groups. From each group, first two teams on the basis of performance were selected for the quarter finals. Unfortunately, they couldn’t make it to the quarters. 
In the humanoid simulation league, it was their second participation. They stood 8th among 13 teams. They were able to defeat 5 different teams in one to one matches. They won a total of 7 matches, drew 3 and were in the quarter finals. They missed the chance to go to the semi finals by just one match!
Next year, the RoboCup will be held in Montreal, Canada. We hope for a better performance and even better results in the upcoming RoboCup.
Link to Competition website: https://www.robocup2017.org/

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team for their stupendous efforts and commendable performance! They have surely made us all proud by putting IIT Kharagpur on RoboSoccer's world map.

(In the picture, Team KRSSG is with the Team Tigers Mannheim in Small Sized League Competition)

Remember the announcement of getting the synthetic track built in Jnan Ghosh Stadium one and half years ago? Plans have been chalked out, the timeline has been rescheduled again and again, but we are yet to see even the first glimpse of any kind of construction work out there. In the series of articles under the column "Your Perspective", we would like to introduce you to the thoughts of a 5th year KGPian who feels that the delay in construction of synthetic track is dampening the spirit of athletes. And now that KGPians have performed brilliantly in sports fests and meets including the recent one in 67th West Bengal State Annual Athletics Meet, "IIT Kharagpur needs the synthetic track more now than ever!"

In case you wish to express your thoughts on a particular topic related to the campus, email them to awaazofiitkgp@gmail.com with the subject as "Your Perspective".
http://awaaziitkgp.org/perspective3.php

Attention 3rd year students:

Honda Foundation has announced the Honda Young Engineer & Scientist (Y-E-S) Award 2017.

The program is open for applications w.e.f. August 01st, 2017, and will remain accessible for on-line applications through the portal http://yes.honda.co.in/ upto August 31st, 2017.

Students who are currently studying in the fifth semester of their 4-year (B.Tech.) or 5-year dual degree (M. Tech.) programs are eligible to apply. Other details of the Award, eligibility criteria, application schedules and the application process will be discussed in the Information Seminar by Mrs. Jyoti Bhatia, Asst. Manager, Honda Motor India Prvt Ltd.

Date - 8th August
Time - 5 PM - 6 PM
Venue - NR 122
